intro: Tradescantia pflanzii, commonly known as the red-veined wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, often clustered in racemes. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Tradescantia pflanzii is popular as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
